media_caption:
American concerns about the Turkish army's invasion of Syrian territory in the area of â€‹â€‹the Kurdish border city of Kobani

The Kurdish area in yellow is adjacent to the border with Turkey and separating two "green islands" controlled by the Syrian rebels.

Last night, Syrian sources reported the concentration of regular Turkish army forces in the Kobani area marked with red dots on the map) as well as the opening of the border gates on the Turkish side.

The American Wall Street Journal published this morning that there are concerns that the Turks will launch a large-scale ground operation in Kobani, despite American pressure (apparently the outgoing American administration's "Don't" does not impress Erdogan).

According to additional reports, last night Turkish warplanes attacked north of the city of Raqqa in the heart of the yellow area (marked with a flame).

content:
Syrian and Russian sources report that the IDF attacked several sites in Syria last night: in Homs, Latakia, and Damascus.

In Damascus, according to these sources, a target was attacked near the area of â€‹â€‹al-Sida Zeinab, sacred to Shiites, in southern Damascus.

Several headquarters of the Syrian Army's Fourth Division and the Radar Battalion in the village of Rahiba in the Damascus province were also attacked.

Abu Muhammad al-Julani - Trying to calm the Druze in Syria

A delegation from the Druze community met tonight in Damascus with Ahmed al-Sharaa (Abu Muhammad al-Julani), leader of the rebel organization Hay'at Tahrir al-Sham.

Al-Sharaa noted that Syria needs to be a unified state, with all its factions, and that the thinking need to start from a state logic and not from the logic of an (armed) opposition, as was the case during the war years.

The Druze, for their part, according to the official publication of the Syrian rebels, told al-Sharaa (what the Arabs wanted to hear:) that they would be an integral part of the Syrian state.

one comment

Yemen: around midnight last night Shiite channels reported an airstrike on the Yemeni Ministry of Defense building (of the Houthis) in Sanaa, the capital of Yemen.

They reported that the planes that attacked Sanaa took off from an Arab country in the Persian Gulf.

Shortly after the attack, the US military, in its quickest acceptance of responsibility in recent years (at least to the best of my memory), announces that it attacked a central Houthi command and control complex in the capital Sanaa.

content:
IDF: Following Three Months of Combat in Southern Lebanon, the 98th Division Prepares for Combat in Gaza

The 98th Division completed their mission in the northern arena last week (Wednesday), after approximately three months of continuous combat against Hezbollah's terrorist strongholds, and conducting their defensive missions following the ceasefire agreement.

The soldiers of the 98th Division are currently preparing for their next mission in the Gaza Strip.

IDF: The 769th Brigade Located Rocket Launchers, Anti-Tank Missiles, and Mortar Shells During Defensive Activities in Southern Lebanon

IDF troops in the Northern Command continue to operate to remove threats posed by Hezbollah and act against Hezbollahâ€™s violations of the ceasefire in accordance with the understandings between Israel and Lebanon.

In the activities of the 769th Brigade, the troops located several weapon storage facilities, including a mobile rocket launcher from which numerous rockets were fired over the past year toward communities in the Galilee Panhandle, dozens of mortar shells, anti-tank missiles, rockets, explosives, mobile launchers, and additional military equipment. All findings were confiscated.
